alert.note: Alert for Benton; Lafayette; Marshall; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:24PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lafayette, northwestern Union, southeastern Marshall and southwestern Benton Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 624 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Laws Hill, or 8 miles south of Wall Doxey State Park, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bethlehem, Cambridge, Etta, Hickory Flat, Potts Camp, Myrtle, Abbeville, Malone, Winborn, Waterford, Old Myrtle, Burt, College Hill Station, Spraggins and Cornersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi.
